abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column notes that Fidelity Management and Research is facing flak from some shareholders of British telecom firm Colt Group over its buyout offer at bargain-basement price; Fidelity says its $2.7 billion bid for Colt is fair, but shareholders say company's prospects are improving.
lead_paragraph: The asset management giant’s plans to buy the Colt Group is angering minority shareholders who feel forced to sell at a bargain-basement price.

headline.main: Fidelity Seen as Muscling Investors Out of Upside in a Telecom Deal
headline.print_headline: Good Deal, at Least for Fidelity

snippet: The asset management giant’s plans to buy the Colt Group is angering minority shareholders who feel forced to sell at a bargain-basement price.
